page.title: 11Coddenham Area Councils
page.content: The Parish Councils of Hemingstone and Coddenham have 5 and 11 voluntary Councillors respectively, from Surveyors, Artists and Farmers to Senior Citizens and Housewives; a cross section of the Community. each Council employs a Parish Clerk. Meetings are held 4 times a year in Coddenham Village Hall and 6 times in Hemingstone Hut; the ruling being that they may not take place on licensed premises. their work is to comment on the appearance and impact of develop- ments, local services, public rights of way and traffic problems i.e. some heavy traffic passes through both villages over two small bridges with no speed limit. Coddenham has no parking areas so there are cars at the roadside. Coddenham Council care for the local recreation ground, closed churchyard and conservation area.
